books.author: by Bob Woodward and Robert Costa
books.description: The Washington Post journalists detail the dangers and challenges during the transition to the Biden presidency.
books.name: PERIL

books.author: by Anderson Cooper and Katherine Howe
books.description: The CNN host and descendant of the Vanderbilt family charts the rise and fall of this American dynasty.
books.name: VANDERBILT

books.author: by Mark R. Levin
books.description: The Fox News host gives his take on the Green New Deal, critical race theory and social activism.
books.name: AMERICAN MARXISM

books.author: by Kate Bowler
books.description: After being diagnosed with cancer at 35, the author of “Everything Happens for a Reason” takes a new look at the advice industry and her own ambitions.
books.name: NO CURE FOR BEING HUMAN

books.author: by Bessel van der Kolk
books.description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.
books.name: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE

books.author: by Stevie Van Zandt
books.description: A memoir by the musician known for playing with the E Street Band, starring on “The Sopranos” and participating in activist causes.
books.name: UNREQUITED INFATUATIONS

books.author: by Laurie Woolever
books.description: An oral biography of the late chef, writer and television host by his longtime assistant and confidante.
books.name: BOURDAIN

books.author: by Joe Posnanski
books.description: The accomplishments of some of the sport’s greatest players past and present are put into context with one another
books.name: THE BASEBALL 100

books.author: by Steven Pinker
books.description: An exploration of several tools of reasoning often overlooked in standard education and some of the causes of irrationality within society.
books.name: RATIONALITY

books.author: by Lucy Adlington
books.description: Twenty-five young inmates of the Auschwitz-Birkenau concentration camp made garments for elite Nazi women.
books.name: THE DRESSMAKERS OF AUSCHWITZ

books.author: by Robin Wall Kimmerer
books.description: A botanist and member of the Citizen Potawatomi Nation espouses having an understanding and appreciation of plants and animals.
books.name: BRAIDING SWEETGRASS

books.author: by Bruce D. Perry and Oprah Winfrey
books.description: An approach to dealing with trauma that shifts an essential question used to investigate it.
books.name: WHAT HAPPENED TO YOU?

books.author: by Malcolm Gladwell
books.description: Famous examples of miscommunication serve as the backdrop to explain potential conflicts and misunderstandings.
books.name: TALKING TO STRANGERS

books.author: by Roxane van Iperen
books.description: Janny and Lien Brilleslijper from Amsterdam were sent by train to Auschwitz when the Jewish safehouse they created in the woods was discovered.
books.name: THE SISTERS OF AUSCHWITZ

books.author: by Heather Heying and Bret Weinstein
books.description: The evolutionary biologists posit that the modern world is out of sync with our ancient brains and bodies.
books.name: A HUNTER-GATHERER'S GUIDE TO THE 21ST CENTURY
